lead_paragraph: Even as Mayor Bill de Blasio works to portray himself as an effective municipal steward ahead of the election, four investigations have put his ability and style under scrutiny.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and WILLIAM NEUMAN

headline.print_headline: Inquiries Upend de Blasio’s Bid to Reboot for ’17
headline.main: Inquiries Cloud de Blasio’s Bid to Come Off as Strong Manager Before ’17 Race

snippet: Even as Mayor Bill de Blasio works to portray himself as an effective municipal steward ahead of the election, four investigations have put his ability and style under scrutiny.
abstract: Increased scrutiny of Mayor Bill de Blasio's governing style complicates his reelection plans for 2017; FBI is looking into de Blasio's own fundraising activities and into actions of New York Police Dept officials under his watch, and city comptroller’s office has opened inquiry into city-approved change to deed that allowed nursing home on Lower East Side to be converted into luxury apartments.
